description: From Hoover, the brand name of one of the first vacuum cleaners, which was sold by The Hoover Company. The American company was founded by William Henry Hoover (1849–1932) and his son Herbert William Hoover, Sr. (1877–1954). The surname Hoover is an Anglicized version of the German Huber, originally designating a landowner or a prosperous small-scale farmer.

entries.meaning: (chiefly Britain, Ireland) A vacuum cleaner, irrespective of brand.

verbs.description: hoover (third-person singular simple present hoovers, present participle hoovering, simple past and past participle hoovered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, Britain) To clean (a room, etc.) with a vacuum cleaner, irrespective of brand.
examples: I need to hoover this room.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, Britain) To use a vacuum cleaner, irrespective of brand.
(transitive) To suck in or inhale, as if by a vacuum cleaner.
